name: Ardtorna B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just rerturned home from 2 excellent nights at the ardtorna with my wife, we had seen Ardtorna on the hotel website and thought we would book it because it looked mordern & a nice place to spend a weekend away. As soon as we arrived we realised why this is a 5 star B&B from the warm welcome we received from Karen & Sean, the attention to detail is incredible, from complimentary chocolates, Whisky, specialised coffees & Molton Brown toiletries to the sophisticated modern decor. The super kingsized bed was extremely comfortable in fact the best nights sleep my wife has had in years.
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the first night we ordered room service food, an antipasti board for two, and were blown away by the value for money & quick service. The breakfast is also excellent, and a vast choice is available for all tastes. We were also privileged to take up the offer of day passes to the Isle of Eriska Hotel & Spa, which is an exclusive resort set in the peaceful tranquility of it's own island. I would recommend anyone staying at the Ardtorna to take up the opportunity that Karen & Sean can offer, as this is an exclusive members and hotel residents only. 2 day passes are available at a very reasonable price. The resort offers the use of the swimming pool, sauna, jacuzzi & steam room, as well as discounts on spa treatments. There is also a 9 hole golf course on the island as well as other activities.
reviews.title: Nice!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would definately recommend the Ardtorna & we look forward to returning in the not too distant future.
reviews.title: the best B&B ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just spent 4 delightful nights at this wonderful place,,, booked as a surprise for my girlfriend and a treat for myself!!! Have to say I dithered for some time between Ardtorna and a similarly well reviewed hotel in the same area, mainly due to having reservations about the whole B&B thing from previous,, let's say,, "interesting" B&B experiences!
reviews.title: Well worth the drive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Needless to say I'm 110% certain I made the right choice,,, Karen and Sean are perfect hosts, unobtrusive yet wonderfully friendly and helpful and it would seem very much determined to provide their customers with nothing short of the finest facilities and service.
reviews.title: Back again and better than ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here back in September when it had just opened.
reviews.title: Ardtrona - Excellent B&B and Owners

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely couple owning it and they honestly couldn't do enough for you. The free whisky was a lovely treat.
reviews.title: The Best B&B in the World

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: They helped us out by providing this accommodation at very short notice. We stayed at their other B&B in Oban.
reviews.title: The best ever bed and breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011
reviews.text: Sorry its taken us so long to review, been so busy and illness meant didn't get round to it.
reviews.title: Fabulous stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thoroughly recommended and we look forward to returning.
reviews.title: A wonderful B&B!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiancé and I stayed at Ardtorna last weekend and had a thoroughly enjoyable time. The view from the room was lovely, looking out over the loch and to the hills. It really was stunning.
reviews.title: Gorgeous Ardtorna - we can't wait to return!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011
reviews.text: The room was finished to a very high standard, and really lived up to its 5 star rating. Everything about the room and the rest of the accommodation was flawless: from the spotless decor to the amazing design. The B & B (calling it that does it a disservice) has some very nice touches for guests; from a free dram (or Baileys if you prefer that as a nightcap) to complimentary tablet in our room. The Molten Brown products in the immaculate bathroom (with Jacuzzi bath) were indicative of the high standard of Ardtorna.
reviews.title: Best B&B by miles!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011
reviews.text: The food was excellent. There was a good choice and the breakfasts we had were cooked to perfection.
reviews.title: Hidden gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As soon as we arrived we didn’t want to leave, and we are already planning our return. We somehow managed to drag ourselves from the uber-comfortable bed (matched only by the bed in the much more expensive Wynn Las Vegas!) and go home, but did so with a heavy heart and a promise to return.
reviews.title: Ardtorna - Awesome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The proprietors, Karen and Sean, were most welcoming and very attentive (but without being overwhelming). They clearly take a lot of pride in what they do; and so they should, because it really is an awesome place to visit. They couldn’t have been nicer to us, and we are looking forward to coming back as man and wife!
reviews.title: Fabulous Boutique B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I booked this as a weekend retreat from the city, just to get away and relax. And that's exactly what we did. Karen and Sean made us SOOOOO welcome. Really friendly and went out of their way for us. Bed was the comfiest I have EVER slept in. I actually wanted to move in but too much of a commute from Glasgow for work. Great selection of food for breakfast, and tasty too. Was so stuffied, was ready to go back to my comfy bed for another sleep. Location is cracking with a gorgeous view. Can't wait to go back, in fact already planning our next stay. Boyfriend's opinion - "Hidden gem!"
reviews.title: Like staying with friends, but so much cooler!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't fault the service provided by Karen, Sean and Fiona - the location, food, room, general service and value for money is all brilliant. Following a hectic work schedule I decided to surprise my fiancee with a weekend break away from Glasgow. We left Saturday morning and visited Oban then arrived at ArdTorna around 3.30pm.
reviews.title: The perfect break!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ArdTorna is not a B&B - it's an exceptional boutique retreat where the service from start to finish is of the highest standards.
reviews.title: Everyone should experience Ardtorna.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tips for people about to visit: definitely ask Karen about Eriska & book before arriving. The restaurant was fully booked when we arrived but sounded excellent. Karen recommended Coast in Oban which was brilliant too!
reviews.title: Heaven!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We'll both be back in the future!
reviews.title: Fabulous B & B!

description: Ardtorna is a purpose built eco friendly property. It is Scotlands only 5 star gold bed and breakfast with the AA. All the deluxe bedrooms with vaulted ceilings are en-suite with either a spa bath and a high powered shower or a wet room. Each bedroom has spectacular loch views. Each room has full sized Molton Brown toiletries, TV, I pod docking station, DVD player, fluffy bath robes, gigantic bath towels, hospitality tray, etc are a few of the items for you to enjoy while staying at our amazing property.Scones straight from the oven are served with clotted cream and home made jam between 4 and 6 pm on the day of arrival.Each bedroom has a fridge with complimentary items such as nuts, sweets etc.During a stay at Ardtorna guests can help themselves to complimentary Malt Whisky and Baileys.We can arrange free transportation to a local restaurant while staying with us. Spa and golf passes are complimentary for any 3 night stays ( This must be arranged at the time of booking , and is subject to availability ).
